results.title: [Effect of metformin combined with intermittent fasting on endoplasmic reticulum stress after cerebral ischemia-reperfusion in mice].
results.text_hl: Methods: One hundred 10-Week-old healthy KM @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@ of SPF grade, weighing 25-28 g, were divided into 5 groups by the random number table method: sham group, focal @DISEASE_Brain_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D002545 @@@cerebral ischemia@@@ group (@<m>DISEASE_Ring_Chromosome_20_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C580424 @@@I/R@@@ group), intermittent fasting group (IF group), @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ group (@CHEMICAL_Methionine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008715 @@@Met@@@ group), @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@+intermittent fasting group (@CHEMICAL_Methionine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008715 @@@Met@@@+IF group).

results.title: Metformin attenuated the inflammation after renal ischemia/reperfusion and suppressed apoptosis of renal tubular epithelial cell in rats.
results.text_hl: METHODS: Eighteen SD @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ were randomly divided into three groups: Sham (S), @DISEASE_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D007511 @@@Ischemia@@@/reperfusion (I/R), and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ (E). Before establishing the I/@<m>DISEASE_Ring_Chromosome_20_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C580424 @@@R@@@ model, group E was administered @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ for three days, while groups S and I/R were administered equal volumes of saline.

citations.NLM: Wang ZS, Liu XH, Wang M, Jiang GJ, Qiu T, Chen ZY, Wang L. Metformin attenuated the inflammation after renal ischemia/reperfusion and suppressed apoptosis of renal tubular epithelial cell in rats. Acta Cir Bras. 2015 Sep;30(9):617-23. PMID: 26465106

results.title: Metformin reduces neuronal damage and promotes neuroblast proliferation and differentiation in a cerebral ischemia/reperfusion rat model.
results.text_hl: The current research found that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ administration reduced @DISEASE_Nerve_Degeneration @DISEASE_MESH:D009410 @@@neuronal damage@@@ in the CA1 area of hippocampus in a @SPECIES_10116 @@@rat@@@ model of I@<m>DISEASE_Ring_Chromosome_20_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C580424 @@@/R.@@@ The number of neuronal nuclei positive neuron was significantly increased and @GENE_GFAP @GENE_24387 @@@glial fibrillary acidic protein@@@ positive astrocyte became obviously declined in the CA1 region in I@<m>DISEASE_Ring_Chromosome_20_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C580424 @@@/R@@@ @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@.

citations.NLM: Yuan R, Wang Y, Li Q, Zhen F, Li X, Lai Q, Hu P, Wang X, Zhu Y, Fan H, Yao R. Metformin reduces neuronal damage and promotes neuroblast proliferation and differentiation in a cerebral ischemia/reperfusion rat model. Neuroreport. 2019 Feb 6;30(3):232-240. PMID: 30614910

results.title: An investigation of the effects of metformin on ovarian ischemia-reperfusion injury in rats.
results.text_hl: The discovery of new agents is always needed in the treatment of this condition. @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ (@<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@MET@@@) has been shown to be beneficial in attenuating @DISEASE_Ovarian_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D010049 @@@ovarian ischemia@@@-@DISEASE_Reperfusion_Injury @DISEASE_MESH:D015427 @@@reperfusion injury@@@.
